text: today I'm using everybody's new favorite
condiments to rochet to make a tomato
sauce for a lighter version of meatballs
lighter but still fantastic and
delicious to start off with have a pound
of ground turkey and a pound of ground
pork I already have them here in my bowl
to that add a third of a cup of dry
breadcrumbs 3/4 of a teaspoon of dry
oregano one and a half teaspoons of salt
and a half teaspoon of black pepper I
don't usually give measured amounts for
salt necessarily but if it's something
that you're not really gonna be able to
taste before it's fully cooked then I
often will just to make it easier but if
you're a low salt kind of person you can
cut back to that add one package of
drained chopped frozen spinach
now the original recipe calls for two
packages which definitely bulks it up a
little bit more but I like it with just
one package so you can use one or two
too that add two egg whites remember
this is a lighter version of Meatballs
so I'm using only the egg whites if you
wanted to use a whole egg go ahead you
would only need one but you definitely
need something here to bind your
meatballs together the spinach can make
these meatballs just a little bit
delicate but the great thing is I'm
going to brown them in the broiler so
they're gonna get all nice and golden
brown but you don't need to mess around
with them like you would if you were
browning them in a pan it's a really
nice method combine everything with your
hands I've yet to find a better tool for
making meatballs or meatloaf than my
hands and believe me I've tried so this
looks plenty spinachy to me the addition
of spinach definitely makes these a
little bit lighter and add some vitamins
and all those good things that you get
from vegetables and it's right here in
your meatball I like to use damp hands
to roll my meatballs you get a much
nicer meatball if your hands are
slightly damp so roll them into about
one inch pieces this makes a lot of
meatballs makes about 50 meatballs this
is something that could definitely
happen in the morning and in fact if you
really wanted to you could make these
ahead and freeze them great to have
meatballs in the freezer have your
broiler preheating to brownies
make sure you wash your hands then put
your meatballs in your brother you're
going to cook these rotate in 1 to 10
minutes so in a large pot heat a couple
teaspoons of olive oil if you're trying
to be low-fat a couple tablespoons if
you're not add one diced onion 2 cloves
of garlic minced you can add a little
bit of salt if you want a little pepper
when your onions are translucent then
you get to add the special ingredient
quarter cup of sriracha you can use any
garlic chilli sauce that you find you
don't have to use the brand sriracha
sriracha seems super popular and I feel
like everybody has it in their
refrigerators now and then 2 cans of
crushed Tomatoes now all you really need
to do for this sauce is to bring it to a
simmer then you're going to add your
meatballs and everything cooks together
for about 10 minutes meatballs cooked
through and the sauce gets a little bit
reduced and cooked down now that my
sauce is simmering I'm going to put my
pasta in because that cooks about the
same amount of time as my meatballs add
some salt to your boiling water this is
a pound of pasta but this is for eight
serving so if you're serving less you
can use less pasta or if you're hearty
eaters well just go ahead and use the
whole box
stir around so it doesn't stick and then
now that your pasta is cooking you can
get your meatballs out of the broiler
and they go directly into the simmering
sauce so they're nice and brown but
they're not completely cooked through so
they need to be transferred to your
sauce stir those down into the sauce and
then just let them simmer away in 10
minutes your dinner will be ready we are
good to go
you don't have to save any pasta water
just go ahead and drain your pasta
and then add your pasta directly into
the pot with the sauce and the meatballs
make sure you have a nice big pot as you
can see this is very very full you can
do your usual like pasta in Bowl with
sauce on top if that's what you like but
I really like to stir my pasta together
with my sauce I think the coating is
much better it's just got much better
coverage you do have to be a little bit
careful when you have meatballs that
they don't fall apart it's very nicely
coated this is a lot of spaghetti and
meatballs it's definitely enough to
serve eight in my opinion okay nicely
coated a couple of twirls of pasta and
then be generous with your meatballs
remember there are plenty how about that
sprinkle with a little bit of parsley
and there you have it it's just a little
bit spicy it's got lots of amazing
flavor from the sriracha give it a try I
think you're going to adore it
hmm oh yes
